intro: Laserpitium prutenicum var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, though the variety glabratum is noted for its smooth, hairless foliage. It is a perennial plant that blooms from late spring to early summer.
